definition: to decline/to wane
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Then decline tone, she is a big mouth to fight over.
sentences.chinese: 话没落音，她就是一个大嘴巴打过来。
有势力的人是如何没落的。

sentences.english: The declining of "Brand Kings"shows the brand crisis of the business administration in China's enterprises.
sentences.chinese: “标王”的没落说明中国企业面临着品牌危机。

sentences.english: A Brahmanic revival appears to have occurred with the fall of the Mauryas.
sentences.chinese: 婆罗门教的复兴是出现在孔雀王朝没落的时期。

sentences.english: He might not mind being placeless, but I mind.
sentences.chinese: 他也许不介意这种没着没落的状态，但是我介意。

sentences.english: The United States is consequently online chase fadeout to fall later.
sentences.chinese: 因而美国在线后来逐渐没落了。
首都耶路撒冷也随之没落。

sentences.english: It started to fall. In the liberation war, and was cracked down after New China was founded.
sentences.chinese: 解放战争时期哥老会走向没落，新中国成立后被摧毁。

sentences.english: Words sound's still declines, but discovering this person is Ping Jue.
sentences.chinese: 话音还没落，却发现这个人是冯爵。

sentences.english: He spent two years wandering about the country at loose ends.
sentences.chinese: 他没着没落地绕着全国到处逛游了2年。

sentences.english: To the Yuan Dynasty, Ding finally and gradually disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 到了元朝，定窑终于逐渐没落。

sentences.english: The household ruin was thus full and orbicular.
sentences.chinese: 这家就这样地完全没落了。

sentences.english: Great powers have retrenched before: Britain for instance.
sentences.chinese: 强国的没落以前有过，英国就是其中一个。

sentences.english: However this flourishing backside, the decline of many helpless?
sentences.chinese: 然而这繁华的背后，没落了几许的无奈呢？

sentences.english: Education will not, the world is full educative derelicts.
sentences.chinese: 教育不可以，受过良好教育的没落者更是随处可见。

sentences.english: Alarmists usually regard the rising generation as a falling one.
sentences.chinese: 危害耸听的人总是把新兴一代当成没落的一代。
